column4: What is wrong? When i boot my computer up, it is frozen on the "[sdc] assuming driver writethrough" step. How do i fish this?
disconnect the power cable to sdc, see if it fixes it. If yes, then start troubleshooting
Funny thing is, SDC is my flash drive?
then pull the drive before boot, then plug it in and look at the dmesg
So just unplug it and try rebooting?
kay, i will let you know how it works. Be back as soon as i reboot, if i reboot and pass through *chuckle*
I'm a little confused.. what OS are you using at this moment?
and which is it that will not boot?
Yea, it still will not boot. It gets stuck on a little white blinking underscore on a black BG
no, I mean which OS will not boot?
you're being obtuse.. you are running 9.04 but 9.04 will not boot..
so you can boot 9.04 live cd but not install.. do I have that right?
Yes, i can boot off livecd
Yes, i used it before i left for a couple dats
So i just let gparted repair my fs. I am going to try to reboot now. If it fails. Ill just restore. For the 4th time (ubuntu is starting to make me mad :\)
